Description of Business and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Description of Business</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Intuit helps consumers, small businesses, and the self-employed prosper by delivering financial management and compliance products and services. We also provide specialized tax products to accounting professionals, who are key partners that help us serve small business customers.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Our flagship brands, QuickBooks, TurboTax and Mint, help customers run their small businesses, pay employees and send invoices, separate business and personal expenses, track their money, and file income taxes. ProSeries and Lacerte are our leading tax preparation offerings for professional accountants. Incorporated in 1984 and headquartered in Mountain View, California, we sell our products and services primarily in the United States.</span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="us-gaap:BasisOfAccountingPolicyPolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-4AA6AB682C325926BF1AA4B08F11CF2C-0-wk-Fact-9A675EC711FA5A399A05DA8B9DC23B25" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Basis of Presentation</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">These condensed consolidated financial statements include the financial statements of Intuit and its wholly owned subsidiaries. We have eliminated all significant intercompany balances and transactions in consolidation. We have included all adjustments, consisting only of normal recurring items, which we considered necessary for a fair presentation of our financial results for the interim periods presented.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Effective August 1, 2019, we adopted the requirements of Accounting Standards Update (ASU) 2016-02, "Leases (Topic 842)" (ASC 842) using the modified retrospective approach, under which financial results reported in prior periods were not restated. As a result, the condensed consolidated balance sheet as of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> is not comparable with that as of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">July&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Funds held for customers represent cash held on behalf of our customers that is invested in cash and cash equivalents and investment-grade available-for-sale debt securities. The purchases, sales and maturities of the investments for our funds held for customers are presented in investing activities in the condensed consolidated statements of cash flows.&#160;Customer fund deposits consist of amounts we owe on behalf of our customers. We present the net change in customer fund deposits in financing activities in the condensed consolidated statements of cash flows. For the </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">six months</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> ended </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, we reclassified </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45837592e553-wk-Fact-FCC94CA5203FC3DC9865769EAE789E01" name="intu:PaymentsForProceedsFromCustomerFundDeposits" contextRef="FD2019Q2YTD_srt_RestatementAxis_srt_RestatementAdjustmentMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">67</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> from investing activities to financing activities to conform to the current presentation, resulting in a decrease in net cash used in financing activities with a corresponding offset to net cash used in investing activities.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">These unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements and accompanying notes should be read together with the audited consolidated financial statements in Part II, Item&#160;8 of our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">July&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">. Results for the </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">six</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> do not necessarily indicate the results we expect for the fiscal year ending </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">July&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> or any other future period.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="us-gaap:FiscalPeriod" id="TextSelection-B8B6176F56DD596D8791EC637CBAE63B-0-wk-Fact-5D2F04FEB2985FFAA64347EC96E260C7" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Seasonality</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Our Consumer and Strategic Partner offerings have a significant and distinct seasonal pattern as sales and revenue from our income tax preparation products and services are heavily concentrated in the period from November through April. This seasonal pattern results in higher net revenues during our second and third quarters ending January 31 and April 30, respectively.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Significant Accounting Policies</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We describe our significant accounting policies in </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Note 1</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> to the financial statements in Part II, Item&#160;8 of our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">July&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">. See the discussion of changes to our lease accounting policy for the adoption of ASC 842, the new leases standard, below. There have been no other changes to our significant accounting policies during the first </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">six</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> months of fiscal </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="us-gaap:LesseeLeasesPolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-C2AA27874C285231801738014799CCB0-0-wk-Fact-3F88F26838B1595CAA01362332864D0D" continuedAt="TextSelection-C2AA27874C285231801738014799CCB0-1" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;color:#0077c5;">Leases </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Our leases are primarily operating leases for office facilities. We do not have significant finance leases. We determine if an arrangement is a lease and classify it as either a finance or operating lease at lease inception. Operating leases are included in operating lease right-of-use (ROU) assets, other current liabilities, and operating lease liabilities on our condensed consolidated balance sheets.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric></ix:nonNumeric><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="4"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:1%;"></td><td style="width:49%;"></td><td style="width:48%;"></td><td style="width:2%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;font-weight:bold;">&#160;Intuit</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;">&#160;Q2 Fiscal 2020 Form 10-Q</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;"> 9</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;" href="#s64E223D5AFFE5818B3BEE723B397EC39"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-A267A20F2C2E51C2BAB42A23000CE822-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-A267A20F2C2E51C2BAB42A23000CE822-2"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-C2AA27874C285231801738014799CCB0-1"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Operating lease liabilities are recognized at commencement date based on the present value of the future minimum lease payments over the lease term. Our leases generally do not have a readily determinable implicit rate, therefore we use our incremental borrowing rate at the commencement date in determining the present value of future payments. Our incremental borrowing rate is determined based on a yield curve derived from publicly traded bond offerings for companies with similar credit ratings to us. Our lease terms may include options to purchase, extend or terminate the lease when it is reasonably certain that we will exercise that option. We account for the lease and non-lease components as a single lease component.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We measure ROU assets based on the corresponding lease liabilities adjusted for any initial direct costs and prepaid lease payments made to the lessor before or at the commencement date, net of lease incentives. Lease expense for minimum lease payments is recognized on a straight-line basis over the lease term. Variable lease payments are not included in the calculation of the ROU asset and lease liability and are recognized as lease expense is incurred. Our variable lease payments generally relate to amounts paid to lessors for common area maintenance under our real estate leases.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Our subleases generally do not relieve us of our primary obligations under the corresponding head lease. As a result, we account for the head lease based on the original assessment at inception. We determine if the sublease arrangement is either a sales-type, direct financing, or operating lease at inception. If the total remaining lease cost on the head lease for the term of the sublease is greater than the anticipated sublease income, the ROU asset is assessed for impairment. Our subleases are generally operating leases and we recognize sublease income on a straight-line basis over the sublease term.</span></div></ix:continuation><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="us-gaap:UseOfEstimates" id="TextSelection-B67C5C458EFE5BF0886134331D4CCB64-0-wk-Fact-FEF0B6E02F4053FDB79FBA48C384BBBA" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Use of Estimates</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">In preparing our condensed consolidated financial statements in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP), we make certain judgments, estimates, and assumptions that affect the amounts reported in our financial statements and the disclosures made in the accompanying notes. For example, we use judgments and estimates in determining how revenue should be recognized. These judgments and estimates include identifying performance obligations, determining if the performance obligations are distinct, determining the standalone sales price (SSP) and timing of revenue recognition for each distinct performance obligation, and estimating variable consideration to be included in the transaction price. We use estimates in determining the collectibility of accounts receivable and notes receivable, the appropriate levels of various accruals including accruals for litigation contingencies, the discount rate used to calculate lease liabilities, the amount of our worldwide tax provision, and the realizability of deferred tax assets. We also use estimates in determining the remaining economic lives and fair values of acquired intangible assets, property and equipment, and other long-lived assets. In addition, we use assumptions to estimate the fair value of reporting units and share-based compensation. Despite our intention to establish accurate estimates and use reasonable assumptions, actual results may differ from our estimates.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-64F24894D24E543BA5AD1AC7E0BCE084-0-wk-Fact-B1DBA95D534E529BA2FB40D62E54F215" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Computation of Net Income (Loss) Per Share</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We compute basic net income or loss per share using the weighted average number of common shares outstanding during the period. We compute diluted net income per share using the weighted average number of common shares and dilutive potential common shares outstanding during the period. Dilutive potential common shares consist of the shares issuable upon the exercise of stock options and upon the vesting of restricted stock units (RSUs) under the treasury stock method.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We include stock options with combined exercise prices and unrecognized compensation expense that are less than the average market price for our common stock, and RSUs with unrecognized compensation expense that is less than the average market price for our common stock, in the calculation of diluted net income per share. We exclude stock options with combined exercise prices and unrecognized compensation expense that are greater than the average market price for our common stock, and RSUs with unrecognized compensation expense that is greater than the average market price for our common stock, from the calculation of diluted net income per share because their effect is anti-dilutive. Under the treasury stock method, the amount that must be paid to exercise stock options and the amount of compensation expense for future service that we have not yet recognized for stock options and RSUs are assumed to be used to repurchase shares.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">All of the RSUs we grant have dividend rights. Dividend rights are accumulated and paid when the underlying RSUs vest. Since the dividend rights are subject to the same vesting requirements as the underlying equity awards they are considered a contingent transfer of value. Consequently, the RSUs are not considered participating securities and we do not present them separately in earnings per share. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">In loss periods, basic net loss per share and diluted net loss per share are the same since the effect of potential common shares is anti-dilutive and therefore excluded.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="4"></td></tr><tr><td #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-A267A20F2C2E51C2BAB42A23000CE822-2" continuedAt="TextSelection-A267A20F2C2E51C2BAB42A23000CE822-3"><ix:nonNumeric style="vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#eaf8ff;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span During the three and </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">six months</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> ended </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, we recognized revenue of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45837592e2622-wk-Fact-EAC508EF9EAD5D1984A8A99EA6BF6E7A" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognized" contextRef="FD2020Q2QTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">154</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45837592e2626-wk-Fact-2F13D60A6BB7A80D5737F373350888FD" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognized" contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">509</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, respectively, that was included in deferred revenue at </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">July&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">. contract date. As of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">July&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, the deferred revenue balance related to performance obligations that will be satisfied after 12 months was </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction is included in other long-term obligations on our condensed consolidated balance sheets.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="us-gaap:ReceivablesPolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-8F7C8B8022EF5C618CF4A4BB0DFFDED1-0-wk-Fact-FAD1018039035845BE4F585E6060E26B" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Notes Receivable and Allowances for Loan Losses</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Notes receivable consist of term loans to small businesses and are included in prepaid expenses and other current assets on our condensed consolidated balance sheets. As of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">July&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, the notes receivable balance was </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45837592e2708-wk-Fact-6F7F1E5D03E75195BCB4F995ABD20B42" name="us-gaap:NotesReceivableNet" contextRef="FI2020Q2" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">103</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45837592e2712-wk-Fact-EB940BBE81D25FA89F1B7C1DB3A57C47" name="us-gaap:NotesReceivableNet" contextRef="FI2019Q4" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">95</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, respectively, and the allowances for loan losses were not significant. The term loans are not secured and are recorded at amortized cost, net of allowances for loan losses. We maintain an allowance for loan losses to reserve for potentially uncollectible notes receivable. We evaluate the creditworthiness of our loan portfolio on a pooled basis due to its composition of small, homogeneous loans with similar general credit risk and characteristics and apply a loss rate at the time of loan origination. The loss rate and underlying model are updated periodically to reflect actual loan performance and changes in assumptions. We make judgments about the known and inherent risks in the loan portfolio, adverse situations that may affect borrowers&#8217; ability to repay and current economic conditions. When we determine that amounts are uncollectible, we write them off against the allowance.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="us-gaap:ConcentrationRiskCreditRisk" id="TextSelection-58E18E6169B45D97B1C5A2357CE22D16-0-wk-Fact-063DA7579F1A51D28D1E392426F5AACD" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:24px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Concentration of Credit Risk and Significant Customers</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">No customer accounted for 10% or more of total net revenue in the three or </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">six</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> or </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">. Due to the seasonality of our consumer tax offerings, one large retailer accounted for </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45837592e2757-wk-Fact-EAC855641F2DBC65F777453F20C75103" name="us-gaap:ConcentrationRiskPercentage1" contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD_srt_MajorCustomersAxis_intu_LargestCustomerMember_us-gaap_ConcentrationRiskByBenchmarkAxis_us-gaap_AccountsReceivableMember_us-gaap_ConcentrationRiskByTypeAxis_us-gaap_CustomerConcentrationRiskMember" unitRef="ratio" decimals="2" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">11</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> of gross accounts receivable at </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">. No customer accounted for 10% or more of gross accounts receivable at </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">July&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="4"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:1%;"></td><td style="width:49%;"></td><td style="width:48%;"></td><td style="width:2%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;font-weight:bold;">&#160;Intuit</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;">&#160;Q2 Fiscal 2020 Form 10-Q</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;"> 11</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;" href="#s64E223D5AFFE5818B3BEE723B397EC39"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-A394E631AE0A52EFA65F15D9E1014F0B-0-wk-Fact-15EB42BFF03A5B1B8CB4FFEF6A92CD29" escape="true"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-A267A20F2C2E51C2BAB42A23000CE822-3"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:20px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Accounting Standards Recently Adopted</span></div></td></tr></table></div><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Leases </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">- </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">In February 2016 the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) issued ASU 2016-02,&#160;&#8220;</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Leases (Topic 842)</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#8221;. This standard amends a number of aspects of lease accounting, including requiring lessees to recognize operating leases with a term greater than one year on their balance sheet as a right-of-use asset and corresponding lease liability, measured at the present value of the lease payments. We adopted this standard in the first quarter of our fiscal year beginning August 1, 2019 using the modified retrospective approach, under which financial results reported in prior periods were not adjusted. We elected certain practical expedients, including the relief package practical expedient which among other things allowed us to carry forward the historical lease classifications. We also elected the practical expedient to combine lease and non-lease components for all asset classes.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">The adoption of ASC 842 on August 1, 2019 resulted in the recognition of ROU assets and operating lease liabilities of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45837592e2822-wk-Fact-D228403649DA5628AC9232C8EFB548FC" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseRightOfUseAsset" contextRef="I2020Q1Aug1_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">319</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45837592e2826-wk-Fact-C6BBC9528001575496DB621F84ED2E38" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseLiability" contextRef="I2020Q1Aug1_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">361</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, respectively, related to our operating leases. Adoption of the standard also resulted in the elimination of deferred rent liabilities of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45837592e2830-wk-Fact-EF905DC20E37500D8486C229E8829B0C" name="us-gaap:DeferredRentCredit" contextRef="I2020Q1Aug1_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">47</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> and prepaid rent of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45837592e2834-wk-Fact-6C86B3CB97F85896B9ECF122D0BE505A" name="us-gaap:PrepaidRent" contextRef="I2020Q1Aug1_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">. Adoption did not result in any cumulative-effect adjustments to retained earnings, and there was no material impact to our condensed consolidated statements of operations or our condensed consolidated statements of cash flows.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:20px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Accounting Standards Not Yet Adopted</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Internal-Use Software</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;"> - </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">In August 2018 the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update (ASU)&#160;2018-15, &#8220;</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Intangibles&#8212;Goodwill and Other (Topic 350): Internal-Use Software.&#8221;</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> This standard aligns the requirements for capitalizing implementation costs incurred in a cloud computing arrangement that is a service contract with the requirements for capitalizing implementation costs incurred to develop or obtain internal-use software. The standard is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2019, including interim periods within those fiscal years, which means that it will be effective for us in the first quarter of our fiscal year beginning August 1, 2020. Early adoption is permitted. We are currently evaluating the impact of our pending adoption of&#160;ASU 2018-15&#160;on our condensed consolidated financial statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Goodwill Impairment</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;"> </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">- </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">In January 2017 the FASB issued ASU&#160;2017-04, &#8220;</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Intangibles&#8212;Goodwill and Other (Topic 350): Simplifying the Test for Goodwill Impairment.&#8221;</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> This standard eliminates Step 2 from the goodwill impairment test. Instead, an entity should compare the fair value of a reporting unit with its carrying amount and recognize an impairment charge for the amount by which the carrying amount exceeds the reporting unit's fair value, not to exceed the total amount of goodwill allocated to the reporting unit. The standard is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2019, including interim periods within those fiscal years, which means that it will be effective for us in the first quarter of our fiscal year beginning August 1, 2020. Early adoption is permitted. We are currently evaluating the impact of our pending adoption of&#160;ASU 2017-04&#160;on our condensed consolidated financial statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Financial Instruments </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">- </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">In June 2016 the FASB issued ASU 2016-13,&#160;&#8220;</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;">Financial Instruments&#8212;Credit Losses (Topic 326).</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">&#8221; This standard requires the measurement of all expected credit losses for financial assets held at the reporting date based on historical experience, current conditions, and reasonable and supportable forecasts. The standard&#160;is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2019, including interim periods within those fiscal years, which means that it will be effective for us in the first quarter of our fiscal year beginning August 1, 2020. Earlier adoption is permitted in the first quarter of our fiscal year beginning August 1, 2019. We are currently evaluating the impact of our pending adoption of ASU 2016-13 on our condensed consolidated financial statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:16px;text-align:justify;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We do not expect that any other recently issued accounting pronouncements will have a significant effect on our financial statements.</span></div></ix:continuation></ix:nonNumeric><div><a id="s8A63C6A7B7665C2CBBC98EC9A20A432F"></a></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock" id="TextSelection-6F2A511183F0543C82CA67893AAA328B-0-wk-Fact-3FDF9EEB571850BD83A8F35BB8CA59F1" continuedAt="TextSelection-6F2A511183F0543C82CA67893AAA328B-1" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:24px;text-align:left;font-size:13pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #0077c5;background-color:#eaf8ff;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:8px;text-align:left;padding-left:78px;text-indent:-78px;font-size:13pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:13pt;color:#0077c5;font-weight:bold;">2. Fair Value Measurements</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Fair Value Hierarchy</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="us-gaap:FairValueMeasurementPolicyPolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-1D0A7B8991E655D6AD4CCC3D6A4010E3-0-wk-Fact-653FC4EC1C4B5A609346F34F8FE97452" continuedAt="TextSelection-1D0A7B8991E655D6AD4CCC3D6A4010E3-1" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">The authoritative guidance defines fair value as the price that would be received from the sale of an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants on the measurement date. When determining fair value, we consider the principal or most advantageous market for an asset or liability and assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or liability. In addition, we consider and use all valuation methods that are appropriate in estimating the fair value of an asset or liability.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric></ix:nonNumeric><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="4"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:1%;"></td><td style="width:49%;"></td><td style="width:48%;"></td><td style="width:2%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:1.5px solid #0077c5;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;font-weight:bold;">&#160;Intuit</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;">&#160;Q2 Fiscal 2020 Form 10-Q</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;"> 12</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;"><a style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;" href="#s64E223D5AFFE5818B3BEE723B397EC39"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">Table of Contents</span></a></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-6F2A511183F0543C82CA67893AAA328B-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-6F2A511183F0543C82CA67893AAA328B-2"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-1D0A7B8991E655D6AD4CCC3D6A4010E3-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-1D0A7B8991E655D6AD4CCC3D6A4010E3-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">The authoritative guidance establishes a fair value hierarchy that is based on the extent and level of judgment used to estimate the fair value of assets and liabilities. In general, the authoritative guidance requires us to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs when measuring fair value. An asset or liability&#8217;s categorization within the fair value hierarchy is based upon the lowest level of input that is significant to the measurement of its fair value. The three levels of input defined by the authoritative guidance are as follows:</span></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Level 1</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> uses unadjusted quoted prices that are available in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.</span></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Level 2</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> uses inputs other than quoted prices included in Level 1 that are either directly or indirectly observable through correlation with market data. These include quoted prices in active markets for similar assets or liabilities; quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in markets that are not active; and inputs to valuation models or other pricing methodologies that do not require significant judgment because the inputs used in the model, such as interest rates and volatility, can be corroborated by readily observable market data for substantially the full term of the assets or liabilities.</span></div></td></tr></table></ix:continuation><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:8px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-1D0A7B8991E655D6AD4CCC3D6A4010E3-2" continuedAt="TextSelection-1D0A7B8991E655D6AD4CCC3D6A4010E3-3"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;padding-left:24px;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;color:#0077c5;font-weight:bold;">&#8226;</span></div></ix:continuation></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-1D0A7B8991E655D6AD4CCC3D6A4010E3-3"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:bold;">Level 3</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> uses one or more unobservable inputs that are supported by little or no market activity and that are significant to the determination of fair value. Level 3 assets and liabilities include those whose fair values are determined using pricing models, discounted cash flow methodologies or similar valuation techniques and significant management judgment or estimation.</span></div></ix:continuation></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:99.80506822612085%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;"><tr><td colspan="1"></td></tr><tr><td style="width:100%;"></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px dotted #0077c5;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:11pt;color:#0077c5;font-style:italic;">Assets and Liabilities Measured at Fair Value on a Recurring Basis</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfFairValueAssetsAndLiabilitiesMeasuredOnRecurringBasisTableTextBlock" id="TextSelection-A70835495EE15E268CFEA8A1AAE00F6A-0-wk-Fact-B0EEDC4CBCD35C6482518D999005E077" name="us-gaap:AvailableForSaleSecuritiesDebtSecurities" contextRef="FI2019Q4_us-gaap_FairValueByMeasurementFrequencyAxis_us-gaap_FairValueMeasurementsRecurringMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></ix:nonNumeric><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We value our Level 1 assets, consisting primarily of time deposits, savings deposit accounts, and money market funds using quoted prices in active markets for identical instruments. Financial assets whose fair values we measure on a recurring basis using Level 2 inputs consist of municipal bonds, corporate notes, and U.S. agency securities. We measure the fair values of these assets with the help of a pricing service that either provides quoted market prices in active markets for identical or similar securities or uses observable inputs for their pricing without applying significant adjustments. Our fair value processes include controls that are designed to ensure that we record appropriate fair values for our Level 2 investments. These controls include comparison to pricing provided by a secondary pricing service or investment manager, validation of pricing sources and models, review of key model inputs, analysis of period-over-period price fluctuations, and independent recalculation of prices where appropriate. </span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div Roman,sans-serif;font-size:13pt;color:#0077c5;font-weight:bold;">3. Cash and Cash Equivalents, Investments, and Funds Held for Customers</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We consider highly liquid investments with maturities of three months or less at the date of purchase to be cash equivalents. In all periods presented, cash equivalents consist primarily of time deposits, savings deposit accounts, and money market funds. Investments consist primarily of investment-grade available-for-sale debt securities. Funds held for customers represent cash held on behalf of our customers that is invested in cash and cash equivalents and investment-grade available-for-sale securities, restricted for use solely for the purpose of satisfying amounts we owe on behalf of our customers. Except for direct obligations of the United States government, securities issued by agencies of the United States government, and money market funds, we diversify our investments in debt securities by limiting our holdings with any individual issuer.</span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" name="intu:CashAndCashEquivalentsInvestmentsAndFundsHeldForCustomersTableTextBlock" style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></ix:nonNumeric><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We use the specific identification method to compute gains and losses on investments. We include realized gains and losses on our available-for-sale debt securities in interest and other income on our condensed consolidated statements of operations. Gross realized gains and losses on our available-for-sale debt securities for the three and </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">six</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> were </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45846743e2132-wk-Fact-CC38796CB455518F8D899B258B9D9780" name="us-gaap:DebtSecuritiesAvailableForSaleRealizedGainLoss" contextRef="FD2020Q2QTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">no</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">t significant. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We accumulate unrealized gains and losses on our available-for-sale debt securities, net of tax, in accumulated other comprehensive income or loss in the stockholders&#8217; equity section of our condensed consolidated balance sheets. Gross unrealized gains and losses on our available-for-sale debt securities at </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">July&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> were </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45846743e2147-wk-Fact-8558170B7EFE54568757A6A1322EF094" name="us-gaap:DebtSecuritiesAvailableForSaleUnrealizedGainLoss" contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">no</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">t significant.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We periodically review our investment portfolios to determine if any investment is other-than-temporarily impaired due to changes in credit risk or other potential valuation concerns. We believe that the investments we held at </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> were not other-than-temporarily impaired. Unrealized losses on available-for-sale debt securities at </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> were not significant and were due to changes in interest rates, including market credit spreads, and not due to increased credit risks associated with specific securities. We do not intend to sell these investments. In addition, it is more likely than not that we will not be required to sell them before recovery at par, which may be at maturity.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><div><br/></div><div Actual margins under either election will be based on our senior debt credit ratings. The amended and restated credit agreement includes customary affirmative and negative covenants, including financial covenants that require us to maintain a ratio of total debt to annual earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization (EBITDA) of not greater than </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45846445e580-wk-Fact-9203C9242D075888AC32A43620A6FB09" name="intu:DebtInstrumentCovenantDebtToEBITDARatioMaximum" contextRef="I2019Q1MAY02_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_intu_AmendmentToMasterCreditAgreementMember_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember" unitRef="ratio" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">3.25</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> to 1.00 as of any date and a ratio of annual EBITDA to annual interest expense of not less than </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45846445e584-wk-Fact-008BC3212ED455079D5B22CE15E7235E" name="intu:DebtInstrumentCovenantEBITDAToAnnualInterestExpenseRatioMinimum" contextRef="I2019Q1MAY02_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_intu_AmendmentToMasterCreditAgreementMember_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember" unitRef="ratio" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">3.00</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> to 1.00 as of the last day of each fiscal quarter. As of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> we were compliant with all required covenants. At </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45846445e597-wk-Fact-730022ABF90D537D9552F825DD729FD7" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityFairValueOfAmountOutstanding" contextRef="FI2020Q2_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_RevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_intu_AmendmentToMasterCreditAgreementMember_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="INF" scale="6" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">no</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> amounts were outstanding under this unsecured revolving credit facility. We paid </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45846445e601-wk-Fact-D0A4B1D09120598B9DCC4C63149FB045" name="us-gaap:InterestPaidNet" The carrying value of the term loan approximates its fair value. Interest on the term loan is payable monthly. Facility</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">On February 19, 2019, a subsidiary of Intuit entered into a </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45847776e595-wk-Fact-B63AA740628D5D88BA88460F988802DF" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="I2019Q1FEB19_dei_LegalEntityAxis_intu_SubsidiaryMember_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_RevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_intu_A2019SecuredRevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="INF" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">300</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> secured revolving credit facility with a lender. The revolving credit facility is secured by cash and receivables of the subsidiary and is non-recourse to Intuit Inc. Advances under this secured revolving credit facility are used to fund a portion of our loans to qualified small businesses. The secured revolving credit facility is available for use for a term of two years and accrues interest at LIBOR plus </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45847776e599-wk-Fact-868B13F24DB25D639603ADB0517A999F" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentBasisSpreadOnVariableRate1" contextRef="D2019Q3FEB19_dei_LegalEntityAxis_intu_SubsidiaryMember_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_RevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_intu_A2019SecuredRevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember_us-gaap_VariableRateAxis_us-gaap_LondonInterbankOfferedRateLIBORMember" unitRef="ratio" decimals="INF" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2.39</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">.&#160;Unused portions of the credit facility accrue interest at a rate of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45847776e603-wk-Fact-7DB078B3A3795BFF80FDAA3597E22D63" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityUnusedCapacityCommitmentFeePercentage" contextRef="D2019Q3FEB19_dei_LegalEntityAxis_intu_SubsidiaryMember_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_RevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_intu_A2019SecuredRevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember" unitRef="ratio" decimals="INF" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.50</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">. Outstanding advances mature on August 19, 2021 and payments made prior to February 19, 2020 are subject to a </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45847776e607-wk-Fact-EE981DAC7EAE5EF3AF7F2FF9AC8AD0D4" name="intu:LineOfCreditFacilityPrepaymentFeePercentage" contextRef="D2019Q3FEB19_dei_LegalEntityAxis_intu_SubsidiaryMember_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_RevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_intu_A2019SecuredRevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember" unitRef="ratio" decimals="INF" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> prepayment fee. The agreement includes certain affirmative and negative covenants, including financial covenants that require the subsidiary to maintain specified financial ratios. As of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> we were compliant with all required covenants. At </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45847776e620-wk-Fact-228EF30461455D1EBD7D63C123307995" name="us-gaap:LineOfCredit" contextRef="FI2020Q2_dei_LegalEntityAxis_intu_SubsidiaryMember_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_RevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_intu_A2019SecuredRevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">48</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> was outstanding under this facility, with a weighted-average interest rate of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45847776e624-wk-Fact-7BE642D3234C51F5BBD3F13F7FB9BCA1" name="us-gaap:DebtWeightedAverageInterestRate" contextRef="FI2020Q2_dei_LegalEntityAxis_intu_SubsidiaryMember_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_RevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_intu_A2019SecuredRevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember" unitRef="ratio" decimals="4" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">7.24</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">, which includes the unused facility fee. The outstanding balance is secured by cash and receivables of the subsidiary totaling </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45847776e628-wk-Fact-04ADB40432BD5E04AC919E9B5113D7ED" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentCollateralAmount" contextRef="FI2020Q2_dei_LegalEntityAxis_intu_SubsidiaryMember_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_RevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_intu_A2019SecuredRevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">123</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">. Interest on the facility is payable monthly. We paid </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d45847776e632-wk-Fact-393D21FF12985AD28530F569947E686C" name="us-gaap:InterestPaidNet" contextRef="FD2020Q2YTD_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_RevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_intu_A2019SecuredRevolvingCreditFacilityMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> for interest on the secured revolving credit facility during the </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">six</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Leases</span></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We lease office facilities under non-cancellable operating lease arrangements. Our facility leases generally provide for periodic rent increases and may contain escalation clauses and renewal options. Our leases have remaining lease terms of up to </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d45849248e474-wk-Fact-49D9222C598C5B4480AE853D072FB827" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseTermOfContract" contextRef="FI2020Q2_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">11</ix:nonNumeric></span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> years, some of which include one or more options to extend the leases for up to </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d45849248e478-wk-Fact-8475720EF148536AA3FE786B799EEC7D" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeaseRenewalTerm" contextRef="FI2020Q2" format="ixt-sec:duryear">10</ix:nonNumeric></span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> years per option, generally at rates to be determined in accordance with the agreements. Options to extend the lease are included in the lease liability if they are reasonably certain of being exercised. We do not have significant finance leases. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">We sublease certain office facilities to third parties. format="ixt-sec:duryear">5</ix:nonNumeric></span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> years, and some include options to extend the leases for up to </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d45849248e489-wk-Fact-85F72B1C257656009483D4FDAFCA2F36" the effects of any discrete income tax items specific to the period. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:9pt;"><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 format="ixt:numdotdecimal">23</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 excess tax benefits on share-based compensation of </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction decimals="-6" scale="6" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">8</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> and </span><span the </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;">three and six</span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"> months ended approximately </span><span style="font-family:Avenir LT Pro 55 Roman,sans-serif;font-size:9pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d45850056e546-wk-Fact-490FEA94A8210E969CE1F38097E8A0B9"
